meanings.definition: To make something or someone seem more attractive or exciting than they really are.
meanings.sent1: She tried to glamorize her plain dress with sparkly accessories.
meanings.sent2: The magazine cover glamorized the celebrity's life, making it seem perfect.
meanings.sent3: He joked that he could glamorize a potato with the right lighting.
meanings.sent4: The movie glamorized the idea of being a spy, but reality is quite different.
meanings.sent5: The advertisement used special effects to glamorize the product and attract customers.

meanings.definition: To make something appear more glamorous or desirable.
meanings.sent1: The marketing team wanted to glamorize the new perfume to increase sales.
meanings.sent2: The makeover show glamorized the idea of a complete transformation.
meanings.sent3: She knew how to glamorize even the simplest outfit with the right accessories.
meanings.sent4: The artist's paintings glamorized everyday scenes into works of art.
meanings.sent5: The event planner knew how to glamorize any venue for a glamorous party.
